--- scottchamilton <scott@...> wrote:

> 
> 
> Do I write my JAVA code in the IDEA environment and
> implement that?   

What code are you referring to?

> The idea is to use JUnit for unit testing.  I read
> on one site where 
> JUNit has a graphic user interface for implementing
> the test code. 

You are referring to the different TestRunners.  Read
here: http://junit.sourceforge.net/

> 
> I don't find documentation on how to implement that.
> 
In IDEA the only thing you need to implment is your
test.


How familiar are you with Java?

How familiar are you with IDEA?

Do you know how to write a TestCase?

Have you been to http://www.junit.org/index.htm and
perhpas read http://junit.sourceforge.net/

And look for IDEA JUnit intergration here:
http://www.jetbrains.com/idea/docs/help/index.html

When you run a Test in Intellij IDEA it uses it's own
integrated graphical test runner (I do not know what
it hooks into JUnit for this).  You do not have to do
anything special to get this to work (at least in the
more recent versions of IDEA).

1. You need to add JUnit to your classpath.

2. Create a new class that extends TestCase.

3. Write a test.

4. Right click and run.

5. Watch in the bottom window.

HTH
Shane
